resources.string: Set in the city center, this luxe hotel with a lavish lobby is a 7-minute walk from Jaipur Junction train station and 3.9 km from the unique Hawa Mahal palace, built to shield royal women from the public.
This upscale hotel is 1.5 km from Jawahar Circle, 2.3 km from Durgapura railway station and 8 km from Rambagh Palace.
In an ornate converted palace dating from 1835, this opulent hotel is 4 km from both Gandhinagar Jaipur train station, and art and history exhibits at the Albert Hall Museum.
Set 1.6 km from the airport, this high-end hotel with Haveli architecture is 12 km from the City Palace complex and the 18th-century Jantar Mantar park.
Set 2.3 km from Durgapura Railway Station, this upscale hotel with a partial glass facade is 14 minutes walk from Jawahar Circle garden and 11 km from Hawa Mahal palace.

It is a traditional dish with a history that is extraordinary as its taste.It is three in one dish that consists of sweet churma, spicy daal, and baati. This combo of ‘Dal Baati Churma’ is a wonderful way to warm yourself up on a cold day!

This mouthwatering dish from the streets of Jaipur is surely one of the everyday morning food items from the Rajasthani cuisine. Steaming hot fiery Pyaaz Ki Kachori with Hot Masala Tea is a perfect winter breakfast.

A classic Indian dessert served in different variety such as plain, malai and mava. It is a disc-shaped sweet cake made with all-purpose flour and soaked in sugar syrup. No Rajasthani food is complete without Ghevar.
For all the spicy food lovers Mirchi Vada is your dish. It is a spicy Indian snack consisting of chili and potato stuffing, served hot with Tamarind chutney.
A full-fledged meal call for a Rajasthani thali. It is an absolute delight to eat a little bit of everything from the best that a cuisine can offer.
The Hawa Mahal stands at the intersection of the main road in Jaipur, Badi Chaupad. It is regarded as the signature building of Jaipur and was built by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh.

Located in Jaipur, The City Palace is the main palace from where the Maharaja reigned from. The palace includes the Chandra Mahan and Mubarak Mahal along with various other buildings within the complex. It is located towards the north-eastern side of Jaipur.
Amber Fort, situated 11 kms from Jaipur, is a fort built with great artistic taste. Cradled on the top of a hill forming a beautiful reflection in Maotha Lake, it is popularly known as Amer Fort.

Nahargarh Fort, situated on the outer skirts of Jaipur is an epitome of great architecture and planning. Drenched with rich past, the fort allows you a picturesque view of the entire city. Built in 1734, this grand architecture is a perfect way to begin the excursion of this pink city.

Albert Hall Museum is one of the oldest museums of Rajasthan. It has a rich collection of various kinds of items such as paintings, carpets, ivory, stone, metal sculptures, colourful crystal works etc.

One of the premium rooftops in Jaipur, House of People has segregated sittings; one can enjoy the live music in lounge or can choose to stay on toes with the rock music in pub area. This beautiful ambiance attracts ladies for free on every Thursdays.
As the names hints a place with complete darkness where you find urself life while dancing to the beats of music relieving yourself from all the hues of stress.
Stylish neon-lit nightclub in a hotel with comfortable seating and a large dance floor.

An ideal destination for Jaipur partygoers which mishmash of all sides of stylish lounge including food, drinks, music & experience. Unwind work and spend nice evening here out with your f-avourite people.
The unmatchable aura of WTF makes it a must visit place, where reunions could be celebrated with chilled beer mugs and delicious choice food.
